Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member slapped a youth during a verbal altercation.
Investigation Youth A/Complainant was interviewed on 08/03/2023 with DHHS
Worker 1 during a previously scheduled video conference. Youth
A stated when placed at the facility he was slapped by a female
staff but could not recall the name of the staff while on his unit.
Youth A stated this interaction started as a verbal altercation after
the staff asked him to get out of Youth B’s personal aisle by their
bed. Youth A recalled Youth B was present for this interaction.
Youth A stated he replied, “I don’t gotta do shit” and did not listen
to her. Youth A stated the staff approached him and were right in
each other's faces. Youth A stated the staff slapped him and then
the two separated. Youth A remarked he did not see staff for the
rest of the day. Youth A did not believe there were any other staff
or youth present when this occurred. He stated he told Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1 about the incident afterwards.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 08/29/2023 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated she is no longer employed at the facility but
at the time when this incident occurred she was Youth A‘s case
manager. Staff 2 stated she had discussed the incident with Youth
A but could not remember any specific dates. She stated Youth A
never reported that he was hit or slapped by any staff. She
recalled Youth A had concerns that a female staff was
disrespectful toward him, and that the incident sounded verbal in
nature. She stated she could not remember what was said or who
the staff was that Youth A was referring to.
Youth B was interviewed during an announced face-to-face visit
at the facility on 09/01/2023. Youth B stated he witnessed the
incident. Youth B stated he and Youth A were the only youth on
the unit and were doing hygiene when Youth A told Youth B he
wanted to show him a video on his tablet. Youth B recalled Youth
A walked over to his personal aisle without asking staff. Youth B
stated Staff 1 was the only staff present. Youth B recalled Staff 1
2

gave Youth A simple instructions on how he was supposed to ask
to step over to Youth B’s personal aisle. Youth B recalled Youth A
appeared to be immediately frustrated with Staff 1 and Staff 1 got
up out of her chair and approached Youth A. Youth B did not
recall exactly what was said next other than Youth A arguing with
Staff 1 and that the two individuals were standing very close to
each other “in each other's face.” Youth B recalled hearing Staff 1
say “you’re standing too close”. Youth B stated Staff 1 held her
hands up to Youth A’s chest and may have touched him, but also
may not have touched him. Youth B stated he knew this because
Youth A did not move backwards, so it appeared to Youth B that
Youth A was not pushed by Staff 1. Youth B stated Youth A
immediately smacked Staff 1’s hands away from near him and
stated, “Don’t fucking touch me.” Youth B stated Staff 1 called for
a supervisor to come in the room and stepped away from Youth A.
Youth B stated he did not see Youth A or Staff 1 interacting with
each other after that point.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed during an announced face-to-face
visit at the facility with DHHS Worker 1 on 09/01/2023. She stated
she was not present for the incident between Youth A and Staff 1
but that she was called into the room immediately afterwards. She
stated when she came into the unit nothing was occurring and her
attention was drawn immediately to Youth A to help him de-
escalate. She stated she was not sure what the argument was.
Youth A said, “get this bitch out my unit.” Supervisor 2 stated she
stood in between Staff 1 and Youth A, and Staff 1 moved out of
the way and was not speaking to Youth A. Supervisor 2 stated
Youth A de-escalated, and there was limited conversation about
what had occurred afterwards. Supervisor 2 recalled making sure
Staff 1 was switched to a different unit for the rest of that day to
avoid any confrontation with Youth A. Supervisor 2 could not recall
if Youth B was present but did not believe any other staff or youth
were present. Supervisor 2 stated she never heard Youth A state
he was hit or slapped by Staff 1.
Contact with Staff 1 did not occur for this investigation despite
attempts made on 08/25/2023, 08/29/2023, 09/01/2023 and
09/07/2023. Staff 1 no longer is employed for the facility.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was not sufficient
evidence found to support a rule violation Staff 1 slapped Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4132 Grievance procedures.
Section (4) An agency shall provide a grievant with a written copy of
Description the grievance resolution.
3

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A filed a grievance and was never provided a resolution.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 08/03/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during a previously scheduled video conference. Youth A stated
he had written a grievance in response to the incident and turned
it into Supervisor 1. He could not recall when he had turned in the
grievance form.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 08/29/2023 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 2 asked Youth A if he was interested in or had
already written a grievance. Staff 2 recalled Youth A not knowing
what a grievance was, and she proceeded to explain the process
to him. She stated Youth A declined to file a formal grievance at
that time, but a few days later she interacted with him and he
asked her to provide him with the form that is used to file a
grievance. Staff 2 stated a few days later Youth A gave the written
grievance form to her. Staff 2 stated she provided this form to
Supervisor 1 the same day. Staff 2 recalled Supervisor 1 stating “I
guess this comes to me” referencing the process for who should
receive a filed grievance within the facility. Staff 2 heard from
Youth A that he had not heard anything about the grievance. Staff
2 stated Youth A never mentioned the grievance or the incident
again during her time working with him.
Youth B was interviewed during an announced face-to-face visit
at the facility on 09/01/2023. During the date interview, Youth B
stated he heard from Youth A that Youth A had filed a grievance
against Staff 1.
Communication with Administrator 1 occurred throughout the
investigation to locate the grievance form that was allegedly filed
by Youth A. On 09/08/2023 Administrator 1 confirmed there was
no grievance located pertaining to the incident.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 09/08/2023 with DHHS Worker
1 over the phone. She did not recall receiving a grievance
form. Supervisor 1 stated she recalled the incident because she
interacted with Supervisor 2 afterwards and they discussed how to
work with Staff 1 on handling situations better. Supervisor 1
stated she did not speak with Staff 2 about a grievance or about
this incident and did not know why Staff 2 had that
recollection. Supervisor 1 confirmed she would have been the
staff to handle a grievance. She recalled there being a folder in a
drawer in her desk where these grievances are located for filing
and one pertaining to this incident was not located.
4

Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was evidence found
that a grievance was filed by Youth A and it was not processed
properly by the facility.
Technical Assistance provided: It was discussed with the Chief
Administrator that procedures for logging and tracking grievances
would be beneficial to ensure proper processing and tracking.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
